post_text: Welcome back HCCS! We have been waiting for this day! Our main goal is to make sure all of our students are in the safest possible learning environment. We have followed all Covid-19 protocols, made many great changes to our buildings, have an abundance of PPE and we are happy to announce that we have contracted with @mygermbusters to disinfect and sanitize the Hellenic Classical Charter Schools #brooklyn and #statenisland. Germbusters apply an Eco-friendly, dual phase process using superheated steam and germicidal UVC lights. Both of these methods kill 99.9% of germs and there are NO HARMFUL CHEMICALS. Together with our dedicated staff we are feeling safer than ever and we are ready to start learning and making great HCCS memories! A big thank you to Germbusters for keeping our #HCCSFAMILY safe! 🤗🆒

Way to go HCCS artists ⭐️ Kindergarten compared 2 paintings to help them think about day and night. After writing words to describe a "daytime" painting and a "nighttime" painting, students drew their own artwork showing day and night.

4th grade learned about artist Faith Ringgold's Story Quilts, and read her book "Tar Beach." Inspired by the story and question, 'What makes you feel free?', students designed their own quilt square.

3rd grade learned about ancient Chinese scroll paintings, especially landscapes. Students looked closely at the natural features in traditional Chinese landscapes like mountains, clouds, and trees, and practiced sketching these trees and plants.

post_text: Sixth grade visits a local supermarket to practice real world math skills 🤗 Students learned how to shop and find specific items. They determined which items were the better buy by using unit price and were able to shop for their own items on a budget. The students paid for their own items and discussed how to determine they are receiving the correct change. They had discussions on how to use coupons with percentages, used their current unit on expressions and equations and wrote algebraic expressions in relation to purchasing items. It was a mathematical fun filled learning day! #hccsproud #hccssmart #hccsmathematicians #hccsstrong #hccscares #blueribbonschool #brooklyn #gohccs

post_text: Our AGT (Ancient Greek Theatre) students were fascinated by the places they visited today! First they saw The Corinth Canal and the ancient ruins of Corinth. More pictures from our Holiday Extravaganza ✨

Today, our HCCS-Park Slope students in grades Pre-K to 8 performed beautifully at our annual Holiday Extravaganza with a theme called “ A Wish for Peace”. The amazing narrators guided the audience throughout the entire performance and told a story about a little girl named Nefeli and the traditions of all the holidays celebrated during the holiday season. Nefeli took us all on a journey along with her friends from all over the world! The Rockettes and the March of the Wooden Soldiers wowed us once again this year as did our talented musicians. It was spectacular ✨ We want to thank all of our amazing families and dedicated teachers for their love and support. Special thank you to our Dean of Dance and Theatre Mr. Petros Fourniotis LaSkar for writing and directing the production and for the amazing choreography! HCCS-PS wishes everyone a beautiful holiday and a Happy and Healthy New Year 2020! #gohccs #hccsproud #hccsstrong

post_text: Today was the 1st Holiday Celebration at HCCS-Staten Island! Our students in grades Kindergarten and First performed beautifully for their families and guests. They sang holiday songs in Greek and in English and put everyone in a happy holiday spirit. In addition the first grade students put on a heartfelt performance called “The Boy and a Tree”. The storyline entails of a little boy who is homeless and finds comfort in a tree unbeknownst to him that the tree may soon not be there anymore. It is a story about empathy, compassion and giving. All the valuable traits we hope to find in every person😌 Congratulations students and teachers! We are all very proud of your hard work and dedication 🤗 Happy Holidays and Happy New Year from everyone at HCCS-Staten Island ✨☃️

A message from our Superintendent, Mrs. Tettonis:
During this special time of thanks, I am writing to share this amazing update our school received from the Water Project. Please take a moment to look at the pictures. The photos show how we were able to make a difference. You will be moved by what we were able to do together to help the school in Kenya. I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone that was able to attend and support the "fun run" held in September on Shore Road. The monies raised that day was sent to The Water Project. A huge thanks to our Dean of Athletics, Mr. Adam for once again coordinating this worthwhile event.
